data.title: Update Gradle wrapper to 2.2 to fix issues with Eclipse
data.body:
See https://issuetracker.springsource.com/browse/STS-3922

The Gradle Integration doesn't work with Eclipse 4.4 at the moment. Terrible...

data.title: Move gdx-pay to a separate repo.
data.body:
Would like to open discussion around moving the gdx-pay extension into its own repo in the libgdx organization. It is rather large, consisting of many projects with third party dependencies and having additional requirements on each platform (and each provider per platform). Further, there is no real tie to gdx itself.

Moving it now, before a release, would reduce the complexity involved in moving it (as we saw with gdx-ai).

data.title: Removed gdx-pay-android-openiab.jar dependency
data.body:
Currently one cannot run the android tests anymore, since there's a build path problem:

"The container 'Android Dependencies' references non existing library '...\libgdx\extensions\gdx-pay\gdx-pay-android-openiab\bin\gdx-pay-android-openiab.jar'.

The android tests project currently depends on the gdx-pay-android-openiab project anyway, so I think it's no problem to remove that "extra" dependency. I could still run the `PayTest`.

data.title: update GWT Matrix4
data.body: I'll never learn

data.title: misc Batch improvements
data.body: Fixed the clockwise overload in `CpuSpriteBatch`, added another `draw(..., Affine2)` overload, misc extensions.

data.title: Add support for converting popular Android ARGB8888 format
data.body: In a recent code review, I found two versions of this function in my code, so I thought it might be a useful addition.  My code originally was Android-only before porting to libGDX, so perhaps others will be in this same situation and will find it convenient.

data.title: changed access modifier of fields to default (no modifier) to avoid eclipse warnings: "access to enclosing field is emulated by a synthetic accessor method"
data.body:
changed access modifier of fields to default (no modifier) to avoid eclipse warnings: "access to enclosing field is emulated by a synthetic accessor method"

there are still 3 warnings....maybe someone more experienced could take a look or give some hints if this is critical and how we can avoid it.....

1.
String name = android.os.Build.MODEL.toLowerCase();
Implicitly using the default locale is a common source of bugs: Use toLowerCase(Locale) instead

2.
protected final class HandlerExtension extends Handler {
This Handler class should be static or leaks might occur (com.badlogic.gdx.pay.android.ouya.PurchaseManagerAndroidOUYA.HandlerExtension)

3.
SecureRandom sr = SecureRandom.getInstance("SHA1PRNG");
Potentially insecure random numbers on Android 4.3 and older. Read https://android-developers.blogspot.com/2013/08/some-securerandom-thoughts.html for more info.

bye
phil

data.title: Various changes, e.g. remove BoundingBox#crn
data.body:
Deprecated BoundingBox#getCorners() and changed it to lazy initialization. This reduces the footprint of the BoundingBox class which is regularly used quite often (e.g. users add a BoundingBox member to each ModelInstance, in which case having a Vector3 array for every instance is just bloating). Ultimately a bounding box only has to contain its minimum and maximum values, perhaps we can eventually remove the other vectors.

Added getCornerXYZ methods as alternative for the getCorners method, as well as some other convenient method (getWidth, getCenterX, etc.).

Deprecated methods that returned a vector3 member and added an alternative to specify the vector to receive the result.

data.title: Fix default launch images in Gradle resources
data.body:
iOS 8 requires launch images to signal what OS version an app supports and hence whether to enable native resolution on iPhone 6 devices.

We should check with whatever Apple dev guide and see if we need to add more launch images to our project resources.

data.title: Default shader doesn't compile always
data.body:
The Benchmark3DTest and similar tests cause crash on my device. Here is the log:

```
10-03 16:00:21.324: E/AndroidRuntime(16689): FATAL EXCEPTION: GLThread 5519
10-03 16:00:21.324: E/AndroidRuntime(16689): com.badlogic.gdx.utils.GdxRuntimeException: Compile failed.
10-03 16:00:21.324: E/AndroidRuntime(16689): ERROR: 0:10: Syntax error, 'tangentFlag' macro redefinition
10-03 16:00:21.324: E/AndroidRuntime(16689): ERROR: 0:11: Syntax error, 'binormalFlag' macro redefinition
10-03 16:00:21.324: E/AndroidRuntime(16689): ERROR: 2 compilation errors. No code generated.
10-03 16:00:21.324: E/AndroidRuntime(16689): Compile failed.
10-03 16:00:21.324: E/AndroidRuntime(16689): ERROR: 0:10: Syntax error, 'tangentFlag' macro redefinition

10-03 16:00:21.324: E/AndroidRuntime(16689):    at com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g3d.shaders.BaseShader.init(BaseShader.java:172)
```

data.body:

data.title: Body.getWorldPoint returns same object everytime it's called
JsonValue typo
Improved mouse buttons handling
data.body:
Following @NathanSweet commit 00526c7ee0976a66322b30d8f5fe73bbb557cc63 (regarding issue #2391), I made the same changes to the JGLFW and Android backend to ignore any unknown button.

I also added actual support for mouse buttons 4 & 5 on all 3 backends. (LWJGL, JGLFW, Android)

I didn't mess with GWT since the platform doesn't actually support anything beyond the first 3 mouse buttons anyway. (That and the fact that the DEV Plugin doesn't work on 64-bit Chrome and on any recent version of Firefox so I couldn't test any change I'd make.)

data.title: Fixed Eclipse warnings
Skin supports BitmapFonts with multiple index.
data.body:
Use case:

Create a BitmapFont with various pages and pack it with TexturePacker (inside the TextureAtlas we would have index 0, index 1, ...).
When adding them to the Skin via Skin#addRegions(TextureAtlas) the index is not used so they are overriden in the map under the same key.

Solution:

Use the index to store the regions under different keys in the map.
This pr allows the Skin to be able to load BitmapFonts with multiple .pngs.

Don't know if this is the best solution for this problem.

data.title: Fixed formatting
iOS occasionally resumes to no meshes, only clear color
"white" drawable in default uiskin is a gradient
data.body: The handy "white" drawable in the default uiskin is a 1x1 pixel that used to render solid in 1.3.1 but now it seems to render as a gradient with a slight alpha. Changing it to a 3x3 white square fixes it.

data.title: Added a Box2D class to load the natives.
data.body:
To offer a more "obvious" solution to problems like https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/2393. Will add a short note about it to the wikipage if it gets merged.

I did not remove the static block in the World class to keep it backwards compatible. It won't be loaded twice since SharedLibraryLoader checks that itself.

data.title: Box2D, create a shape before creating a world failed
data.body:
Pardon my English. When using box2D, the following code failed:

 CircleShape circleShape = new CircleShape();

resulting this error:
java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.CircleShape.newCircleShape()J
    at com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.CircleShape.newCircleShape(Native Method)
    at com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.CircleShape.<init>(CircleShape.java:30)

But if I change the code to:

 new World(new Vector2(0, -10), true);
 CircleShape circleShape = new CircleShape();

then, it runs flawlessly. I did some digging, according to  https://code.google.com/p/libgdx/issues/detail?id=5  
it seems calling GdxNativesLoader.load() will solve this problem in the ealier version of libgdx, but I tested in 1.3.1, this trick doesn't work.

data.title: StringBuilder append long and int: changed ugly ifs to use switch case
Mouse buttons 4 and 5
data.body: The mouse buttons 4 and 5 under Windows (by default mapped to forward and backward, for example in browsers) are currently indistinguishable in libGDX. A generated event either uses the Left, Right or Middle mouse button. While being able to map these buttons would be nice, it is not my main concern. Currently, events from these buttons are (in my case) treated as if they were in fact from the left mouse button. I would wish for these events to either not be generated, or allow them to be distinguished from a left mouse click event.

data.title: Type org.robovm.apple.uikit.UIApplicationLaunchOptions cannot be resolved.
data.body:
I don't know what to do with this error... I have everything imported but it is saying "The type org.robovm.apple.uikit.UIApplicationLaunchOptions cannot be resolved."
I looked into robovm-cocoatouch-0.0.14.jar and there is no UIApplicationLaunchOptions in org.robovm.apple.uikit so where is the problem?

data.title: add SWSpriteBatch
data.body: It's possible to define a custom `Batch` whose transform matrix may be changed without flushing. For subsequent draws, the vertices are simply adjusted in software. This can improve performance in cases where the batch would keep being interrupted by transformable Groups. For example, in a UI it allows scaling a `Table` (squashing a button) without interrupting the batch.

data.title: Don't force batch flush when drawing group children
data.body:
It's possible to define a custom `Batch` whose transform matrix may be changed without flushing. For subsequent draws, the vertices are simply adjusted in software. I expect the performance gain from longer batches to easily offset this transformation overhead (especially for 2D).

For my [prototype](http://pastebin.com/hDuggVwu) I had to do a nasty hack, because `Group` insists on flushing the batch when `transform` is set. Could we remove the `flush()` from `Group.drawChildren()`?

data.title: Added color markup support for label and window title.
data.body: This should fix issue https://github.com/libgdx/libgdx/issues/1934

data.title: Screen rotation doesn't work correctly on iOS.
data.body:
When the phone is rotated the viewport is not resized correctly resulting in graphics that don't fit to the screen. See this topic:
http://www.badlogicgames.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=11&t=16518

There needs to be a call to Gdx.gl20.glViewport at some point after rotation but my knowledge of the libgdx code isn't good enough for me to be able to resolve this confidently.
